content:
iraq War veteran Captain Paul Chappell will share his insight into war and peace tonight at  p.m PERIOD in the Multicultural Center PERIOD

Chappell who wrote a book titled Will War Ever End A Soldiers Vision of Peace for the twenty-first  Century will reveal how his experience during deployment shaped his outlook on the prospects of attaining a peaceful society PERIOD Chappell also serves as director of Santa Barbaras Nuclear Age Peace Foundation leadership program which assists students working towards nuclear disarmament PERIOD

Chappell said he hopes to use his perspective as a soldier to illustrate that peace can mean more than just the absence of war PERIOD

By speaking I hope to give a sense of empowerment Chappell said PERIOD There are problems in the world that we can solve. according to Chappell his time at West Point and seven years of service in the military actually caused him to adopt an antiwar stance PERIOD

Many people who join the army and go to war do it because they want peace Chappell said PERIOD

Human Rights Group copresident Tammy Fisher a fourthyear global studies and political science major said the experience that Chappell brings to his speech is a priceless commodity for students attempting to understand world affairs more fully PERIOD

He has a general education about a subject that affects all of us Fisher said PERIOD

Anna Zitter a firstyear biology major said it is vital for students to hear a direct account of the situation in Iraq PERIOD

He is someone who knows firsthand how ugly war can be Zitter said PERIOD I think its very important because its advice coming from someone who has been through war. print

Comments are closed PERIOD

Forgetting to take off the ratty AF1s at the potluck most Asian households dont take kindly to shoes in the house

Wearing your only red tshirt to every final Red is a lucky color in many cultures especially Chinese cultures

Putting spiders in your friends wedding dress for good luck Has its origins in old english folklore and represents abundance for the couple

Accidentally summoned a ghost by leaving their chopsticks straight up A superstition that has Chinese origins because the chopsticks are reminiscent of funeral incense

Didnt like your friends significant other so they gifted them an umbrella The word for umbrella san sounds like the word for divorce in Chinese

Believing in horoscopes The modern western zodiac actually came from Babylonian astrology

Walked backwards in Portugal to live out the Faust fantasy In Portugal walking backwards allows the devil to know exactly where you are

Stole a raven from the tower of london as reparations According to UK superstition if there arent  ravens in the tower the kingdom will fall

Breaks a knuckle knocking on wood for good scores on finals Knocking on wood may have originated from the Celts and their love for tree spirits

Drunkenly rearranging their apartment for the feng shui at  AM A Chinese cultural practice that harmonizes a person with the energies of the environment around them

Left out their middle name on their taxes because the Fae run the IRS Giving the Fae your full name gives them power over you and the IRS has too much

Hit by a car but the license plate had an angel number Beyond just blowing up on TikTok angel numbers were invented by.. PERIOD Pythagoras
title: American Soldier To Visit, Tell Stories of Foreign Conflict | The Daily Nexus
